add_categories_desc: Group your values into categories to create a structured table. Each value will be assigned to a category based on your matching method.
add_categories_info: Organize your values into groups by assigning each value to a category. This creates a structured table from your list of values.
analyze_files: I'll analyze your files and suggest how to connect them.
api_error: Could not connect to data.gouv.fr. Please try uploading files instead.
ascent_categorize_info:
Define categories to organize your L1 values. You can:
1. Enter custom categories manually, OR
2. **Use unique values from a column** as categories directly
ascent_complete_info: You've completed the ascent! You can continue exploring with different dimensions or start fresh.
ascent_complete_msg: You've completed the ascent! You can continue exploring with different dimensions or start fresh.
ascent_completed: Ascent completed! Your redesigned dataset is ready.
ascent_linkage_desc: L2 → L3: Enrich with linkage keys

brand_tagline: The next stage of open data
build_connected_info_desc: Your connected information will be built instantly. No setup needed.
building_joined_table: Building joined table using row-vector semantic matching...
cannot_expand_reason: This value wasn't calculated from a list.
cannot_start_redesign: Cannot start redesign - descent data incomplete
categories_help: Enter categories separated by commas (e.g., 'Sales, Marketing, Engineering')
categories_input_placeholder: e.g., PRIVE, PUBLIC or High, Medium, Low
choose_calculation: Choose how to calculate a final result from your values.
choose_entity_column: Choose an entity type and column for domain categorization.
choose_unique_identifiers_help: Choose columns that contain unique identifiers useful for your analysis
click_columns_instruction: Click on columns that might link your files together (like IDs or codes):
columns_for_joins_help: These columns will be prominently displayed for future joins
commune_names_link: **Commune names** can link to geographic/administrative data
config_complete_l3_ready: Configuration complete! Your joined L3 dataset is ready.
configuration_complete: Configuration complete! Moving to next step...
confirm_start_fresh: This will clear all your uploaded files and progress. Are you sure?
connection_type_help: Label for the connection between items
could_not_analyze: Could not automatically analyze your files. Please continue manually.
could_not_create_joined: Could not create joined table. Try lowering the matching strictness in Step 2.
create_connections_desc: Select a column to extract as a new item type. Unique values in this column will become items linked to your data rows.
create_connections_info: Pick a column to create a connected view of your data. Each unique value becomes an item that connects to your data rows.
dataset_confirmed: Dataset confirmed! Your L3 table is ready.
define_entities_core: Please define entities and select a core entity
define_entity_connections: Define how entities connect: Key Matching or Semantic Similarity
descent_complete: Descent complete! Here are your results:
download_csv_info: Download each level's data directly as CSV files.
download_failed: Could not download file. Please try again or choose another dataset.
each_record_shows: Each record shows what it connects to
ensure_ollama_running: Make sure Ollama is running: `ollama serve`
enter_at_least_one_category: Please enter at least one category to proceed.
enter_categories: Enter the categories you want to group by:
enter_item_type_name: Please enter a name for the item type.
enter_openai_key: Please enter your OpenAI API key
exact_matching_info: Exact matching connects items that have the same identifier values.
expand_result_info: See all the values that were used to calculate this result. The original list of values is preserved and can be restored.
expansion_unavailable_info: Expansion is only available for calculated results. This value was entered directly, so there is no source list to show.
export_csv_info: Download each level's data directly as CSV files.
files_with_columns: **{files} files** with **{columns} columns** - click to select
finding_matching_items: Finding matching items between your files...
found_items_connections: Found {items} items across {categories} categories, with {connections} connections
graph_viz_info: Graph visualization is available when data is stored as a knowledge graph.
how_strict_matching: How strict should the matching be?
info_built_instantly: Your connected information will be built instantly. No setup needed.
item_type_help: Name for the new item type
item_type_name_label: Name for this type of item:
joined_l3_desc: Here's your unified L3 table built from semantic connections:

linkage_keys_description: Linkage keys are columns that can connect your data to external datasets:

matching_strictness_help: How strict should matching be? (higher = fewer matches)

no_csv_available: No CSV files available in this dataset
no_entity_nodes: No entity nodes found in the graph.
no_items_connections: No items or connections found in your data.

select_columns_linkage: Select columns to expose as linkage keys
select_columns_step1_first: Please select at least 2 columns in Step 1 first.
select_from_2_files: Select columns from at least 2 different files to create connections between them.

simplified_l3_caption: Showing only L2 columns + selected linkage keys

smart_matching_desc: I'll look for items in both files that share the **same or similar values** in your selected columns, then link them together automatically.
smart_matching_help: Use AI to find similar items (smarter but slower)
start_exploring: Start exploring to see the exploration tree

step_domains_desc: What categories do you want to organize your data by?
step_entities_desc: What are the main things you want to see in your connected information?
step_features_desc: What values do you want to extract?
step_upload_desc: Upload your raw data files (CSV format)
strict_looser_desc: Stricter = fewer connections but more accurate; Looser = more connections but may include mismatches
transform_data: Transform your data from chaos to clarity through guided questions.
try_different_keywords: Try different keywords or a broader search term.
try_different_query: Try a different search query or upload your own files below.
tutorial_description: Understanding the methodology behind intuitive data redesign
uai_codes_link: **UAI codes** (education) can link to official school databases
upload_data_first: Please upload data first in the guided workflow
upload_instruction: Upload one or more CSV files to begin the redesign process.
what_would_you_like: What would you like to do?
whats_happening_desc: I'm looking at your selected columns to find **matching items** between your files. For example, if both files have a school code, I'll use that to connect related information together.
